alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 4:32PM MST until August 10 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 745 PM MST. * At 422 PM MST, the public reported elevated flow in Big Bug Creek. Between 0.25 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Spring Valley, Cordes, Cordes Junction, Cordes Lakes and Mayer. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 263 and 272. Interstate 17 between mile markers 258 and 266. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Antelope Creek, Dry Creek, Sycamore Creek, Big Bug Creek, Wolf Creek, Yarber Wash, Indian Creek, Cedar Creek, Turkey Creek, Government Spring Wash, Badger Spring Wash, Ash Creek, Agua Fria River, Mineral Creek, Hackberry Creek and Little Ash Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
